New Records: Emilio Nsue, at the age of 34, scored five goals in the group stages and became the oldest player to score five or more goals in an AFCON.
Jose Machin became one of only three players to provide an assist in three consecutive AFCON matches, joining Yaya Toure and Martin Hongla.
Key Match Events: Bikoro scored in the 55th minute for Equatorial Guinea.
Bayo scored in the 90+8th minute for Guinea.
Jeanvier received a yellow card in the 41st minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted Equatorial Guinea to win based on their impressive group stage performance.
Equatorial Guinea defied pre-tournament odds to win Group A.
Guinea secured a spot in the round of 16 as one of the top four best-ranked third-placed teams.
Post-Match Reflections: The match ended with Guinea winning 1-0 against Equatorial Guinea.
Equatorial Guinea's journey in the tournament ended in the round of 16.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This match marked the first time that Guinea faced Equatorial Guinea.
The match took place at Stade Olympique Alassane Ouattara in Abidjan.
